meanings.definition: To soften or rot fruit by fermentation.
meanings.sent1: She blets the apples to make them sweeter.
meanings.sent2: The pear blets quickly in the warm sun.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten oranges blets in the bottom of the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The neglected bananas blets into a mushy mess on the counter.
meanings.sent5: The grapes blets slowly, releasing a sweet aroma.

meanings.definition: A state of fermentation or decay in fruit.
meanings.sent1: The blets of the peach gave it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent2: The blets of the strawberries attracted fruit flies.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was filled with the smell of blets from the overripe plums.
meanings.sent4: The blets of the mangoes signaled the end of summer.
meanings.sent5: The market sold fruit at different stages of blets.

meanings.definition: The process of softening or rotting fruit by fermentation.
meanings.sent1: The blets of the apples took several days.
meanings.sent2: The blets of the pears spread to the neighboring fruits.
meanings.sent3: The blets of the peaches created a sweet, tangy juice.
meanings.sent4: The blets of the bananas attracted fruit flies to the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The blets of the grapes produced a rich, fruity aroma.
